com.stormpath.sdk.servlet.account

Class AccountStringResolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stormpath.sdk.servlet.account.AccountStringResolver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Resolver<String>

    public class AccountStringResolver
extends Object
implements Resolver<String>
    A Resolver that locates the account associated with the current request using an AccountResolver, converts the located account to a String via a Function<Account,String>, and returns that String to the caller.

    If an account cannot be resolved (for example, the request is not authenticated or a user not remembered from a previous authentication), null is returned to indicate no account could be located.

    If an account is located, the default configuration returns a JSON representation of the account. A different account String representation can be returned by configuring a different accountStringFunction.

    Since:
    1.1.0
    See Also:
    setAccountResolver(AccountResolver), setAccountStringFunction(Function)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AccountStringResolver()
      Default constructor that uses a ResourceJsonFunction to convert any discovered account to a string.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AccountStringResolver

        public AccountStringResolver()
        Default constructor that uses a ResourceJsonFunction to convert any discovered account to a string.

    • Method Detail

      • setAccountStringFunction

        public void setAccountStringFunction(Function<Account,String> accountStringFunction)
        Sets the function used to convert a discovered Account to a String representation.

        Unless overridden, the default instance is a ResourceJsonFunction, which returns a JSON representation of the account.

        Parameters:
        accountStringFunction - the function used to convert a discovered Account to a String representation.

      • setAccountResolver

        public void setAccountResolver(AccountResolver accountResolver)
        Sets the account resolver to use to look a request's associated account. Unless overridden, the default instance is a DefaultAccountResolver. Once located, the account will be converted to a string using the accountStringFunction.
        Parameters:
        accountResolver - the account resolver to use to look a request's associated account.

      • get

        public String get(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Returns a string representation of the request's associated account or null if an account is not available.

        This method locates the account associated with the current request using the accountResolver, converts the located account to a String with the accountStringFunction, and returns the resulting String.

        If an account cannot be resolved (for example, the request is not authenticated or a user not remembered from a previous authentication), null is returned to indicate an account is not available.

        Specified by:
        get in interface Resolver<String>
        Parameters:
        request - the inbound request
        response - the outbound response
        Returns:
        a string representation of the request's associated account or null if an account is not available.
